subject: Re: [junit] junit for set Method with boolean input and void retu rn
msgSnippet: ... It s a matter of personal taste.  Personally, I don t have any problems adding entry points to my classes just to make them easier to test.  The question
messageBody:
On 2/6/06, Kamal Ahmed <KAhmed@...> wrote:
>
> Cédric,
>
> I really appreciate your response, but adding a boolean isAcceptMatch()
> method to WmLoggerFilter, would mean changing the class which is under
> test.
> Could this be an acceptable test case?


It's a matter of personal taste. Personally, I don't have any problems
adding entry points to my classes just to make them easier to test. The
question is usually more along the lines of "what visibility should these
entry points have?" and "package-protected" is usually a good default.

If you don't want to do that, your alternative is to introspect your class
(using setAccessible(true)) and verify that your private field received the
expected value...

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
